name: Attribute

name: BooleanParameter
description_summary: _Boolean Parameter_ is a case of [Control Couple](Control-Couple.md), where a

name: ClassVariable
description_summary: Class variables form part of the global runtime state, and as such make it easy for one part of the system to accidentally or inadvertently depend on another part of the system. So the system becomes more prone to problems where changing something over here breaks something over there. In particular, class variables can make it hard to set up tests (because the context of the test includes all global state).

name: ControlParameter
description_summary: _Control Parameter_ is a case of [Control Couple](Control-Couple.md).

name: DataClump
description_summary: In general, a _Data Clump_ occurs when the same two or three items frequently

name: DuplicateMethodCall
description_summary: Duplication occurs when two fragments of code look nearly identical, or when two fragments of code have nearly identical effects at some conceptual level.

name: FeatureEnvy
description_summary: _Feature Envy_ occurs when a code fragment references another object more often than it references itself, or when several clients do the same series of manipulations on a particular type of object.

name: InstanceVariableAssumption
description_summary: Classes should not assume that instance variables are set or present outside of the current class definition.

name: IrresponsibleModule
description_summary: Classes and modules are the units of reuse and release. It is therefore

name: LongParameterList
description_summary: A _Long Parameter List_ occurs when a method has a lot of parameters.

name: LongYieldList
description_summary: A _Long Yield List_ occurs when a method yields a lot of arguments to the block

name: ManualDispatch
description_summary: Reek reports a _Manual Dispatch_ smell if it finds source code that manually checks whether an object responds to a method before that method is called. Manual dispatch is a type of [Simulated Polymorphism](Simulated-Polymorphism.md) which leads to code that is harder to reason about, debug, and refactor.

name: MissingSafeMethod
description_summary: Candidate methods for the _Missing Safe Method_ smell are methods whose names

name: ModuleInitialize
description_summary: A module is usually a mixin, so when an `#initialize` method is present it is

name: NestedIterators
description_summary: A _Nested Iterator_ occurs when a block contains another block.

name: NilCheck
description_summary: A _Nil Check_ is a type check. Failures of _Nil Check_ violate the

name: RepeatedConditional
description_summary: _Repeated Conditional_ is a case of

name: SubclassedFromCoreClass
description_summary: Candidate classes for the _Subclassed From Core Class_ smell are classes which inherit from Core Classes like Hash, String and Array.

name: TooManyConstants
description_summary: _Too Many Constants_ is a case of [Large Class](Large-Class.md).

name: TooManyInstanceVariables
description_summary: _Too Many Instance Variables_ is a case of [Large Class](Large-Class.md).

name: TooManyMethods
description_summary: _Too Many Methods_ is a case of [Large Class](Large-Class.md).

name: TooManyStatements
description_summary: A method with _Too Many Statements_ is any method that has a large number of lines.

name: UncommunicativeMethodName
description_summary: An _Uncommunicative Method Name_ is a method name that doesn't communicate its

name: UncommunicativeModuleName
description_summary: An _Uncommunicative Module Name_ is a module name that doesn't communicate its

name: UncommunicativeParameterName
description_summary: An _Uncommunicative Parameter Name_ is a parameter name that doesn't

name: UncommunicativeVariableName
description_summary: An _Uncommunicative Variable Name_ is a variable name that doesn't communicate

name: UnusedParameters
description_summary: _Unused Parameter_ refers to methods with parameters that are unused in scope of the method.

name: UnusedPrivateMethod
description_summary: Classes should use their private methods. Otherwise this is dead

name: UtilityFunction
description_summary: A _Utility Function_ is any instance method that has no dependency on the state of the instance.
